code_value: A study found a link between brain size and climate, but the results showed that temperature has much less influence on brain size than it does on body size. Instead, the researchers linked more stable climates with bigger brains. “The more stable the climate is, the larger brains are.” said Dr. Will, “You need a lot of energy to maintain a big brain. In stable environments, it’s easier to get more food resources, so you are more likely to have sufficient nutrition to give you that energy.”
